page.title: 16THE RIVER CAM_FLOODING
page.content: The River Cam is a tributary of the River Yeo. Queen Camel,West Camel, Urgashay and Bridgehampton lie in the lower half of the catchment and are those frequently affected by flooding. The River Cam is small with extensive tree cover over most of it's length. There are 7 road bridges and several accomodation bridges.A number of these cause large build ups of water during high flows.The river responds quickly to rainfall over the catchment and flooding is a regular occurrence, probably every 2_3 years.The 1979 event was the most severe , resulting in flooding to 47 properties including farms ,shops,this school and a public house.It occurred at the end of May. The river burst it's banks at 9.00pm and had flooded some homes by 11.00pm to a depth of 1m.One farmer at Langport lost all his 600 pigs.
